Interview Questions: What type of hours are you available to work?

title: Curator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Virginia Tech
Interview Descriptions: I attempted to apply for a Curator position at the Moss Center. References were requested but it was not clear if the online system would be automatically sending an email request to my references, which universities sometimes do even for staff positions. I emailed the HR contact given and inquired. I received a reply saying that he wasn't sure and that I should contact someone else directly. This person turned out to be the hiring manager, ie. the person I was applying to work for. I found this to be awkward but forwarded the HR email to this person and reiterated my question. My email was ignored. In short, the application was unclear, HR was unable to perform their function of answering basic questions and serving as a liaison between applicants and the hiring department/ manager, and I was then ignored by the hiring manager herself. Needless to say, with this level of dismissal and disfunction, I was no longer interested in the position.
Interview Questions: Couldn't be bothered to answer basic application question

title: Lab Manager Interview

title: Chef De Cuisine Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Virginia Tech
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of 2 parts. A verbal interview and a 'mystery box' cooking part. For the verbal part you must know all your ServSafe trivia and temperatures. Otherwise generic questions. For the 'mystery box' cooking part you are given a mystery box of ingredients of which you must use all of the given ingredients in an appetizer and an entree. A chef will be monitoring you throughout the test and taking notes. If he is nice he will point out some of the things you are doing wrong before he deducts points. Pay extreme attention to being absolutely sanitary!! I got a big deduction because I took a bite of a vegetable and threw the remaining piece in the trash. There was absolutely no contact with my mouth and anything else, but it was bad practice. Mind your towels carefully and make sure you don't cross-contaminate. Warm your plates for hot food, and cool them for cold. I would say pay more attention to being sanitary than being flavorful. Poorly seasoned food will not cost you the job, but a health code violation will knock you out immediately.
Interview Questions: How to cook quail, chayote, and brie all in one dish.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Virginia Tech in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a full time instructor position with Virginia Tech's English Department. The close date for applications was 5/30 and candidates were contacted in mid June. I was contacted June 16th to set up a Skype interview with a 6 person hiring committee. My Skype interview was scheduled for June 30th. The interview went very well. I was questioned by each member of the committee and afterward I was told I would be "notified within 2 weeks either way."  Come August 6th, I realized I had heard nothing back on the position, and the start date was to be August 10th. I sent an email asking the status of the position and received no response. Today, one month from sending the email, the status of the job changed to "Position Filled" and my followup email remains unanswered. I feel it is highly unprofessional of this institution to fail to follow through when a candidate is told they will hear back within 2 weeks. Even a form email notifying candidates of the position being filled would be more appropriate than no contact or response at all.  If you apply to a teaching position with Virginia Tech, be aware you may not be notified if you are no longer being considered for the job.
Interview Questions: The most unexpected question I received was regarding diversity in the classroom. I did not prepare to answer this question and had to offer my response on the fly because I have always taught for highly diverse colleges and had never thought about speaking to teaching differently in a diverse environment since it is all I know.

Theory, simulation tools, used machine, simulation tools and results were asked. Lots of questions were done tail by tail during explanation. After then, explained the project that employer is related. Then asked to describe an idea how to do the project based on my previous experience.
Interview Questions: Understanding the NSF project.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Virginia Tech (Blacksburg, VA) in Dec 2008
Interview Descriptions: Day long review with faculty and staff.  Presentation required.  Interview with commitee and with faculty group with whom I'd be working.  Meeting with upper level administration that is funding the position.
Interview Questions: Name a conflict that you could have resolved better or that had unexpected consequences.

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Virginia Tech (Blacksburg, VA) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: The process was pretty fast, given that the university has to follow state policies. There was a 3 person interview committee that gave a recommendation to the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: standard questions, the committee is reading off a list.

title: Residential Computer Consultant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Virginia Tech (Blacksburg, VA) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions:
The interview went smoothly. Most of the stuff was technical such as if you have ____ problem how would you solve it. The other technical questions were very basic which was surprising. They just seemed to skirt the subject of computer repair instead of dive deeply into them.

It took a few weeks for them to get back to me and offer a position. Of course I accepted. The pay wasn't bad for an undergrad position but it didn't come with any benefits either. Unfortunately the position no longer exists because they've consolidated all computer support to the 4Help desk.
Interview Questions: How would you go about diagnosing a computer that has a network problem and cannot connect to the school ethernet.
